item.title: Afghanistan: The desperate scramble to escape
item.description: The BBC witnesses scenes of chaos and panic as thousands still crowd Kabul's airport.

item.title: China NPC: Three-child policy formally passed into law
item.description: The top legislature was also expected to approve a controversial anti-sanctions law for Hong Kong.

item.title: Child handed over wall amid Kabul airport chaos
item.description: Afghans try to scale airport walls and shots are fired as crowds keep trying to flee the Taliban.

item.title: Covid: Sydney lockdown extended and curfew imposed on 2m people
item.description: Residents of the country's largest city now face stay-at-home orders until at least the end of September.

item.title: 'I play carrom with my feet'
item.description: Twenty-three-year-old Harshad Gothankar was born without arms, but he is now a state carrom champion.

item.title: Nine Afghan girl robotics team members safe in Qatar
item.description: The all-girls team, known as the "Afghan Dreamers" have made headlines around the world.

item.title: Paralympics: Para-badminton player Palak Kohli on preparing for Tokyo 2020
item.description: Palak Kohli is the only Indian para-badminton player to be competing in three categories in Tokyo.

item.title: Hackers steal nearly $100m in Japan crypto heist
item.description: The incident comes days after $600m of cryptocurrencies was stolen from another digital platform.

item.title: BHP sacked 48 over sexual harassment and assaults at Australian mines
item.description: An Australian inquiry has heard allegations of rape and sexual harassment at remote mining camps.

item.title: Facebook moves to protect Afghan users' accounts amid Taliban takeover
item.description: The tech giant says it wants to reassure people worried about being tracked down by the Taliban.

item.title: Zaki Anwari: Afghan footballer falls to death from US plane in Kabul
item.description: Zaki Anwari, 19, had played for Afghanistan's national youth team before trying to flee the country.

item.title: How Afghanistan's media is changing under Taliban rule
item.description: The Taliban are currently on a media offensive but does their rhetoric match whatâ€™s happening on the ground?

item.title: 'They will kill me': Desperate Afghans seek way out after Taliban takeover
item.description: Many Afghans are desperate to escape after the Taliban takeover. Some fear there is no way out.

item.title: 'It was very emotional on the plane out of Afghanistan'
item.description: Afghan businesswoman Hassina Syed speaks of her relief at getting out on a British military plane.

item.title: Afghanistan: The Taliban's victory will test India, and peace in South Asia
item.description: How India engages with the Taliban after Afhraf Ghani left Afghanistan could determine the region's fate.

item.title: Ramappa temple: The Indian shrine that is now a World Heritage site
item.description: The 800-year-old temple in India's southern state of Telangana is now on the tourist map.

item.title: What is Sharia law? What does it mean for women in Afghanistan?
item.description: The Taliban say they will govern Afghanistan according to Sharia, or Islamic law

item.title: Uncertain times ahead for Afghan women
item.description: After the Taliban takeover, it is not yet clear how women will fare with the militants in power.

item.title: Afghanistan: Will it become haven for terror with the Taliban in power?
item.description: The Taliban are back, 20 years after being ousted for supporting terror groups. Will they do the same?

item.title: There and back again: The epic adventures of China's wandering elephants
item.description: After a mammoth journey across the country the pack of pachyderms are finally heading home.
